notes_display: Part of a set of 14 facsimile notes in a red, white, and blue envelope. Possibly issued to commemorate the US Bicentennial in 1976. Each note has the word "COPY" printed in tiny letters in the bottom left corner of the front. Part of set "B"
issue_obverse_legend_s: TWO HUNDRED & FIFTY DOLs. | THIS Bill of TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS shall be exchanged and redeemed in Spanish Milled Dollars, or the Value thereof in Gold or Silver, at the rate of One for Forty, at the Trea-sury of VIRGINIA, on or before the 30th Day of December, 1792, according to an ACT of ASSEMBLY passed the 1st Day of March, 1781. | SEVENTY FIVE POUNDS. | VIRGINIA CURRENCY.
